Exaggerate: The claim may be seen as exaggerating the ease with which premeditation can be formed in murder cases.
Understate: The claim may understate the complexity and planning typically associated with premeditation.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to prove its validity.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that premeditation can be formed quickly and easily, without considering the legal requirements or standards.
Exist alternative explanation: There may be alternative explanations or interpretations of premeditation in different jurisdictions or legal systems.
